verses.kjv: Thou shalt not raise a false report: put not thine hand with the wicked to be an unrighteous witness.
verses.web: “You shall not spread a false report. Don’t join your hand with the wicked to be a malicious witness.
verses.ct: Don't spread false reports. Never team up with a wicked person to give dishonest testimony.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not follow a multitude to do evil; neither shalt thou speak in a cause to decline after many to wrest judgment:
verses.web: “You shall not follow a crowd to do evil. You shall not testify in court to side with a multitude to pervert justice.
verses.ct: Don't follow a crowd into doing evil. When you testify in a legal case, don't side with the majority just to twist justice.

verses.kjv: Neither shalt thou countenance a poor man in his cause.
verses.web: You shall not favor a poor man in his cause.
verses.ct: Don't show favoritism to a poor person in a lawsuit either.

verses.kjv: If thou meet thine enemy’s ox or his ass going astray, thou shalt surely bring it back to him again.
verses.web: “If you meet your enemy’s ox or his donkey going astray, you shall surely bring it back to him again.
verses.ct: If you come across your enemy's ox or donkey wandering off, you must bring it back to him.

verses.kjv: If thou see the ass of him that hateth thee lying under his burden, and wouldest forbear to help him, thou shalt surely help with him.
verses.web: If you see the donkey of him who hates you fallen down under his burden, don’t leave him. You shall surely help him with it.
verses.ct: If you see the donkey of someone who hates you collapsed under its load, don't walk away. You must stop and help him with it.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not wrest the judgment of thy poor in his cause.
verses.web: “You shall not deny justice to your poor people in their lawsuits.
verses.ct: Don't deny justice to your poor people when they bring a case to court.

verses.kjv: Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.
verses.web: “Keep far from a false charge, and don’t kill the innocent and righteous; for I will not justify the wicked.
verses.ct: Stay far away from false accusations. Never put an innocent or righteous person to death, because I will not let the guilty go unpunished.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt take no gift: for the gift blindeth the wise, and perverteth the words of the righteous.
verses.web: “You shall take no bribe, for a bribe blinds those who have sight and perverts the words of the righteous.
verses.ct: Never accept a bribe, because bribes blind people who can see clearly and corrupt the words of honest people.

verses.kjv: Also thou shalt not oppress a stranger: for ye know the heart of a stranger, seeing ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
verses.web: “You shall not oppress an alien, for you know the heart of an alien, since you were aliens in the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: Don't oppress a foreigner. You know what it feels like to be a foreigner, because you yourselves were foreigners in the land of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And six years thou shalt sow thy land, and shalt gather in the fruits thereof:
verses.web: “For six years you shall sow your land, and shall gather in its increase,
verses.ct: For 6 years, plant your land and harvest its crops.

verses.kjv: But the seventh year thou shalt let it rest and lie still; that the poor of thy people may eat: and what they leave the beasts of the field shall eat. In like manner thou shalt deal with thy vineyard, and with thy oliveyard.
verses.web: but the seventh year you shall let it rest and lie fallow, that the poor of your people may eat; and what they leave the animal of the field shall eat. In the same way, you shall deal with your vineyard and with your olive grove.
verses.ct: But during the 7th year, let the land rest and leave it unplowed. The poor among your people can eat whatever grows on its own, and the wild animals can eat what's left over. Do the same with your vineyards and olive groves.

verses.kjv: Six days thou shalt do thy work, and on the seventh day thou shalt rest: that thine ox and thine ass may rest, and the son of thy handmaid, and the stranger, may be refreshed.
verses.web: “Six days you shall do your work, and on the seventh day you shall rest, that your ox and your donkey may have rest, and the son of your servant, and the alien may be refreshed.
verses.ct: Work for 6 days, but rest on the 7th day so that your ox and donkey can rest, and so that the children of your servants and the foreigners among you can be refreshed.

verses.kjv: And in all things that I have said unto you be circumspect: and make no mention of the name of other gods, neither let it be heard out of thy mouth.
verses.web: “Be careful to do all things that I have said to you; and don’t invoke the name of other gods or even let them be heard out of your mouth.
verses.ct: Pay careful attention to everything I've told you. Never speak the names of other gods — don't even let their names come out of your mouth.

verses.kjv: Three times thou shalt keep a feast unto me in the year.
verses.web: “You shall observe a feast to me three times a year.
verses.ct: Celebrate a festival in my honor 3 times a year.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt keep the feast of unleavened bread: (thou shalt eat unleavened bread seven days, as I commanded thee, in the time appointed of the month Abib; for in it thou camest out from Egypt: and none shall appear before me empty:)
verses.web: You shall observe the feast of unleavened bread. Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, as I commanded you, at the time appointed in the month Abib (for in it you came out of Egypt), and no one shall appear before me empty.
verses.ct: Observe the Festival of Unleavened Bread. For 7 days, eat bread made without yeast at the appointed time in the month of Abib, just as I commanded you — because that's the month you came out of Egypt. No one is to appear before me empty-handed.

verses.kjv: And the feast of harvest, the firstfruits of thy labours, which thou hast sown in the field: and the feast of ingathering, which is in the end of the year, when thou hast gathered in thy labours out of the field.
verses.web: And the feast of harvest, the first fruits of your labors, which you sow in the field; and the feast of ingathering, at the end of the year, when you gather in your labors out of the field.
verses.ct: Also celebrate the Festival of Harvest, when you bring in the first fruits of the crops you planted. And celebrate the Festival of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you bring in everything from your fields.

verses.kjv: Three times in the year all thy males shall appear before the LORD God.
verses.web: Three times in the year all your males shall appear before the Lord LORD.
verses.ct: 3 times a year, every male among you must appear before the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread; neither shall the fat of my sacrifice remain until the morning.
verses.web: “You shall not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread. The fat of my feast shall not remain all night until the morning.
verses.ct: Don't offer the blood of my sacrifice alongside bread made with yeast. The fat from my festival offering must not be left out overnight until morning.

verses.kjv: The first of the firstfruits of thy land thou shalt bring into the house of the LORD thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother’s milk.
verses.web: You shall bring the first of the first fruits of your ground into the house of LORD your God. “You shall not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.
verses.ct: Bring the very best of the first fruits from your land to the house of the LORD your God. Don't boil a young goat in its mother's milk.

verses.kjv: Behold, I send an Angel before thee, to keep thee in the way, and to bring thee into the place which I have prepared.
verses.web: “Behold, I send an angel before you, to keep you by the way, and to bring you into the place which I have prepared.
verses.ct: I am sending an angel ahead of you to guard you along the way and bring you to the place I have prepared.

verses.kjv: Beware of him, and obey his voice, provoke him not; for he will not pardon your transgressions: for my name is in him.
verses.web: Pay attention to him, and listen to his voice. Don’t provoke him, for he will not pardon your disobedience, for my name is in him.
verses.ct: Pay close attention to him and obey what he says. Don't rebel against him, because he won't forgive your disobedience — my name is in him.

verses.kjv: But if thou shalt indeed obey his voice, and do all that I speak; then I will be an enemy unto thine enemies, and an adversary unto thine adversaries.
verses.web: But if you indeed listen to his voice, and do all that I speak, then I will be an enemy to your enemies, and an adversary to your adversaries.
verses.ct: But if you truly obey his voice and do everything I say, then I will be an enemy to your enemies and an opponent to your opponents.

verses.kjv: For mine Angel shall go before thee, and bring thee in unto the Amorites, and the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Canaanites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites: and I will cut them off.
verses.web: For my angel shall go before you, and bring you in to the Amorite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Canaanite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite; and I will cut them off.
verses.ct: My angel will go ahead of you and bring you into the land of the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Canaanites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites — and I will wipe them out.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not bow down to their gods, nor serve them, nor do after their works: but thou shalt utterly overthrow them, and quite break down their images.
verses.web: You shall not bow down to their gods, nor serve them, nor follow their practices, but you shall utterly overthrow them and demolish their pillars.
verses.ct: Don't bow down to their gods or worship them. Don't follow their practices. Instead, completely tear them down and smash their sacred pillars to pieces.

verses.kjv: And ye shall serve the LORD your God, and he shall bless thy bread, and thy water; and I will take sickness away from the midst of thee.
verses.web: You shall serve LORD your God, and he will bless your bread and your water, and I will take sickness away from among you.
verses.ct: Worship the LORD your God, and he will bless your food and your water. I will remove sickness from among you.

verses.kjv: There shall nothing cast their young, nor be barren, in thy land: the number of thy days I will fulfil.
verses.web: No one will miscarry or be barren in your land. I will fulfill the number of your days.
verses.ct: No woman in your land will miscarry or be unable to have children. I will give you a full lifespan.

verses.kjv: I will send my fear before thee, and will destroy all the people to whom thou shalt come, and I will make all thine enemies turn their backs unto thee.
verses.web: I will send my terror before you, and will confuse all the people to whom you come, and I will make all your enemies turn their backs to you.
verses.ct: I will send terror ahead of you. I will throw every nation you encounter into confusion, and I will make all your enemies turn and run from you.

verses.kjv: And I will send hornets before thee, which shall drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite, from before thee.
verses.web: I will send the hornet before you, which will drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite, from before you.
verses.ct: I will send hornets ahead of you to drive out the Hivites, the Canaanites, and the Hittites before you arrive.

verses.kjv: I will not drive them out from before thee in one year; lest the land become desolate, and the beast of the field multiply against thee.
verses.web: I will not drive them out from before you in one year, lest the land become desolate, and the animals of the field multiply against you.
verses.ct: But I won't drive them all out in a single year, or the land would become deserted and wild animals would overrun it.

verses.kjv: By little and little I will drive them out from before thee, until thou be increased, and inherit the land.
verses.web: Little by little I will drive them out from before you, until you have increased and inherit the land.
verses.ct: Little by little I will push them out ahead of you, until your population has grown large enough to take possession of the land.

verses.kjv: And I will set thy bounds from the Red sea even unto the sea of the Philistines, and from the desert unto the river: for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand; and thou shalt drive them out before thee.
verses.web: I will set your border from the Red Sea even to the sea of the Philistines, and from the wilderness to the River; for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand, and you shall drive them out before you.
verses.ct: I will establish your borders from the Red Sea to the sea of the Philistines, and from the desert to the Euphrates River. I will hand the people living in the land over to you, and you will drive them out.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt make no covenant with them, nor with their gods.
verses.web: You shall make no covenant with them, nor with their gods.
verses.ct: Don't make any covenant with them or with their gods.

verses.kjv: They shall not dwell in thy land, lest they make thee sin against me: for if thou serve their gods, it will surely be a snare unto thee.
verses.web: They shall not dwell in your land, lest they make you sin against me, for if you serve their gods, it will surely be a snare to you.”
verses.ct: They must not live in your land, or they will lead you to sin against me. If you worship their gods, it will become a trap that destroys you.
